description:
本节目为沪江部落一档美语发音模仿节目，每期节目选取30秒左右的慢速VOA新闻内容，主持人亲自朗读示范模仿发音，对发音要点进行讲解，并配以详细的语音语调示意图，手把手教你练就地道美音范儿！想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？去沪江部落订阅本节目！

今日主持人：EstateLee

30秒音频：

模仿文本：Julie Felgar works on environmental issues for Boeing. She said the plant also has many more seeds than traditional tobacco plants do. She said only the oil from the seeds will be used to make biofuel now. But researchers are trying to develop ways to use the entire plant to make fuel.

译文：波音公司的茱莉•菲尔加的工作与环境问题相关。她声称这种烟草的种子产量远高于以往的品种，虽然现在只有种子榨出的油能被制成燃料，但她也说研究者们正在寻找将整个植株转化成燃料的方法。

小编模仿慢速：

小编模仿常速：

Felgar \ˈfel-gär\
environmental \in-ˈvī-rə(n)-mənt, -ˈvī(-ə)r(n)-\
Boeing \bōiŋ\
tobacco \tə-ˈba-(ˌ)kō\
biofuel \ˈbiō -fyü(-ə)l\

title: BBC模仿秀: 新加坡迎来50周年国庆

description:
《英闻天天译》是一档沪江部落的原创翻译互动节目（戳去参与节目>>>），主持人提供翻译参考文本，对大家递交的翻译作品进行点评，和大家共同进步！本期节目选取的是关于最老《古兰经》低调百年华丽现身的一则英文报道，让我们一起在翻译中关注。














BACKGROUND: 

The university's academics were "startled" when the radiocarbon dating tests showed it was so old

CONTENT：

What may be the world's oldest fragments of the Koran have been found by the University of Birmingham.
Radiocarbon dating found the manuscript to be at least 1,370 years old, making it among the earliest in existence.
The pages of the Muslim holy text had remained unrecognised in the university library for almost a century.
The British Library's expert on such manuscripts, Dr Muhammad Isa Waley, said this "exciting discovery" would make Muslims "rejoice".
The manuscript had been kept with a collection of other Middle Eastern books and documents, without being identified as one of the oldest fragments of the Koran in the world.
When a PhD researcher looked more closely at these pages it was decided to carry out a radiocarbon dating test and the results were "startling".
The university's director of special collections, Susan Worrall, said researchers had not expected "in our wildest dreams" that it would be so old.
 
KEY POINTS:
the Koran《可兰经》
Radiocarbon dating 放射性碳年代测定法
Muhammad Isa Waley 穆罕默德·伊萨·韦利
rejoice 欣喜（be very pleased）
a collection of 许多、一批、一堆
startling 令人吃惊的
special collections 特色馆藏
Worrall （人名）沃洛
 
REFERENCE
http://www.bbc.com/news/business-33436021
 
【沪江英语小编】大家在查看主持人提供的翻译版本前，可以先自己进行尝试翻译练习，只有在不断的翻译中翻译能力才能有所提升哦！

轻松注册沪江，马上参与【英闻天天译】节目练翻译→

本期节目参考译文：（参考译文由该节目主持人提供，仅供参考，欢迎大家讨论）

参考译文1：

世界上迄今为止最古老的《可兰经》残页已被伯明翰大学所发现。
利用放射性碳年代测定法，发现这幅手稿至少有1,370年的历史，是现存最古老的版本。
穆斯林圣书的这些残页在伯明翰大学图书馆中存放了近百年都未曾遇到伯乐。
大英图书馆此类手稿方面的专家穆罕默德·伊萨·韦利博士说，这个“激动人心的发现”会让穆斯林们“喜出望外”。
该手稿之前一直同许多其他中东书卷、文件存放在一起，但从未有人认出它是世界上最古老的《可兰经》残卷。
直到一个博士研究员凑近去看这些纸页时，他才决定对它们进行放射性碳年代测定，不想，结果却是如此“惊人”。
该大学图书馆特色馆藏区主任苏珊·沃洛说，研究员们“做梦”也想不到它会如此古老。

title: 英闻天天译: 最老《古兰经》

description:
《英文天天写》是沪江部落一档写作类节目，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

  

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Turn around
Turn around means to go back the original way. Who or what is going around? What is the reason?
This week's topic: They turned around... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) heading towards the incorrect direction on the highway
2) heard one's name called
3) received a call about an event which just took place
4) when someone else entered the room
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

“Whatever you do, don't turn around.” was the last thing Wolfe heard. As he continued to walk down the hallway, he was not sure what just happened. He heard the model take a few steps down the hallway in the other direction, and then with a very bright tone called out, “Good afternoon! It's great to see you here.” Wolfe recalled the warning “Don't turn around,” if that could be considered a warning. So he kept walking straight ahead. Soon enough, he knew he made the right decision when he heard the model continue speaking.

description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！

Valenti是西班牙语，其意为“勇敢”。歌曲来自宝儿第二张专辑《VALENTI／为爱勇敢》这张专辑呈现出更加浓郁的R&B和Hip-Hop音乐风格，宝儿的嗓音也显得更加成熟、更加具有穿透力，对歌曲的把握和演绎也更加得心应手。

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Valenti

description:
And a British doctor says there is evidence that snipers in another part of the country are using civilians for target practice. David Noether is a consultant general surgeon in the UK for the National Health Service. He's just returned from volunteering at a hospital in northern Syria. He's been explaining to Rebecca Kesby some of the horrific wounds medical teams are dealing with and the distressing details of how civilians including pregnant women are being targeted.

What I saw there was constant gunshot wounds, sniper wounds, targeting women and children and civilians, starting off from about 8 o'clock in the morning, going on to 2, 3 o'clock in the morning. And it was constant, it was relentless. It happened every single day. And every morning, you didn't know what you're gonna face.

When did you become suspicious that there was a pattern emerging that some people were being targeted specific areas of their bodies?

Our hospital, say, would receive 12 to 14 casualties, gunshot wounds. And then of those 12 to 14, you would have probably seven or eight which had targeted in exactly the same area. So if you had seven or eight children that'd come in, they'd all be targeted in their shoulder. And you think that's a bit odd, this, in either their left shoulder or the right shoulder and then the rest of them obviously were either chest or abdomen or whatever. And then I thought about it, and I then became a bit suspicious that this was not just one-off, this may be something that's happening all the time. And so I was kept sort of log in my head really about that.
